body: Similar to other dependencies like winpty or winapi, I'd say that a crate should build on every operating system. If it is pulled in or not is a different matter. But there's no way to support both X11 and Wayland at runtime without pulling both in at build time, the only option would be to support a "no-wayland" feature flag.

issue.title: Build failure on BSD

repository.name: client-toolkit
repository.description: Smithay's toolkit for writing wayland clients

issue.body:
It looks like the wayland client toolkit fails to build on OpenBSD 6.4. This has been reported to Alacritty here: https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/1784.

The relevant error output is the following:
```
   Compiling smithay-client-toolkit v0.4.1
error[E0432]: unresolved import `nix::sys::memfd`
 --> /home/user/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/smithay-client-toolkit-0.4.1/src/utils/mempool.rs
  |
4 | use nix::sys::memfd;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ no `memfd` in `sys`

error: aborting due to previous error
```

I'd propose a breaking change to make this crate empty by default if the build target is not Linux, this way it should always build on all systems. Note that other crates like winapi do something similar.

body: I've reported this upstream here: https://github.com/smithay/client-toolkit#41. It should be an easy fix, so I might look into resolving this myself later today.
@thendiscard I've released a new version of SCTK that should compile on BSD. Can you confirm?

@vberger I've updated https://github.com/Smithay/client-toolkit/issues/41, SCTK compiles fine on OpenBSD, thanks!

I didn't want to put the details here since now I have another build failure for alacritty, in a dependency completely different than SCTK. I'll update this issue with more details shortly.

Unfortunately alacritty still doesn't build OpenBSD, this time it's related to the latest change in https://github.com/alexcrichton/filetime for which I've opened a new issue: https://github.com/alexcrichton/filetime/issues/33 : 

```bash
user ~/ALACRITTY/alacritty $ cargo build --release
 Downloading static_assertions v0.3.0
 Downloading base64 v0.10.0
 Downloading euclid v0.19.2
 Downloading smithay-client-toolkit v0.4.2
   Compiling cfg-if v0.1.6
   Compiling nodrop v0.1.13
   Compiling memoffset v0.2.1
   Compiling scopeguard v0.3.3
   Compiling lazy_static v1.2.0
   Compiling libc v0.2.43
# ......................................................
   Compiling shared_library v0.1.9
   Compiling rand v0.4.3
   Compiling filetime v0.2.3
error[E0425]: cannot find value `lutimes` in module `libc`
  --> /home/user/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/filetime-0.2.3/src/unix/utimes.rs:12:42
   |
12 |     super::utimes(p, atime, mtime, libc::lutimes)
   |                                          ^^^^^^^ did you mean `futimes`?

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`.
error: Could not compile `filetime`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```

https://github.com/alexcrichton/filetime/issues/33 was fixed (by https://github.com/alexcrichton/filetime/pull/34) and the version of filetime bumped to 0.2.4 . With filetime 0.2.4 I can successfully build and use alacritty on OpenBSD 6.4-current .

However filetime is *pinned* (is that the correct term ?) to 0.2.3 in [alacritty/Cargo.lock](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/6265ef91d5496461fcd1025b21323982f3e47085/Cargo.lock#L715) . I'm not sure how to proceed, should I open an alacritty PR with the Cargo.lock changes ? I've checked and https://github.com/passcod/notify doesn't have a Cargo.lock, notify only specifies `filetime = "^0.2.1"` in it's Cargo.toml . Again, I'm not a rust developer so I'm not familiar with how these details are usually handled for rust projects.

```bash
user ~/ALACRITTY/alacritty $ cargo update -v -p filetime
    Updating crates.io index
    Updating git repository `https://github.com/zacps/winpty`
    Updating filetime v0.2.3 -> v0.2.4
```
```diff
user ~/ALACRITTY/alacritty $ git diff
diff --git a/Cargo.lock b/Cargo.lock
index 948fc8d..ee07498 100644
--- a/Cargo.lock
+++ b/Cargo.lock
@@ -713,7 +713,7 @@ dependencies = [

 [[package]]
 name = "filetime"
-version = "0.2.3"
+version = "0.2.4"
 source = "registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index"
 dependencies = [
  "cfg-if 0.1.6 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)",
@@ -1408,7 +1408,7 @@ version = "4.0.6"
 source = "registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index"
 dependencies = [
  "bitflags 1.0.4 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)",
- "filetime 0.2.3 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)",
+ "filetime 0.2.4 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)",
  "fsevent 0.2.17 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)",
  "fsevent-sys 0.1.6 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)",
  "inotify 0.6.1 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)",
@@ -2848,7 +2848,7 @@ dependencies = [
 "checksum expat-sys 2.1.6 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)" = "658f19728920138342f68408b7cf7644d90d4784353d8ebc32e7e8663dbe45fa"
 "checksum failure 0.1.3 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)" = "6dd377bcc1b1b7ce911967e3ec24fa19c3224394ec05b54aa7b083d498341ac7"
 "checksum failure_derive 0.1.3 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)" = "64c2d913fe8ed3b6c6518eedf4538255b989945c14c2a7d5cbff62a5e2120596"
-"checksum filetime 0.2.3 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)" = "b3ea0c97183a611b1673e5e28b160d7e1035106cad053c988aae3bbd996fdcce"
+"checksum filetime 0.2.4 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)" = "a2df5c1a8c4be27e7707789dc42ae65976e60b394afd293d1419ab915833e646"
 "checksum flate2 1.0.4 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)" = "3b0c7353385f92079524de3b7116cf99d73947c08a7472774e9b3b04bff3b901"
 "checksum fnv 1.0.6 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)" = "2fad85553e09a6f881f739c29f0b00b0f01357c743266d478b68951ce23285f3"
 "checksum font-loader 0.6.0 (registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index)" = "2fbd86bafc9e14ab7076e084d31eed4633120f910d0c42a017e5382aac89937f"
```
```bash
user ~/ALACRITTY/alacritty $ cargo build --release
 Downloading unicode-width v0.1.5
 Downloading serde_derive v1.0.80
 Downloading bitflags v1.0.4
 Downloading x11-dl v2.18.3
 Downloading serde v1.0.80
 Downloading serde_yaml v0.8.7
# ........................................................
   Compiling image v0.20.1
   Compiling smithay-client-toolkit v0.4.2
   Compiling winit v0.18.0
    Finished release [optimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 9m 01s

user ~/ALACRITTY/alacritty $ target/release/alacritty -V
alacritty 0.2.3
````

@thendiscard v0.2.3 doesn't mean it's pinned to one specific version. Even if you specify a dependency with 0.2.3, a non-breaking update can still be automatically applied using `cargo-update`. So feel free to just run that command and send a PR!

issue.title: Update filetime to v0.2.4
issue.body:
filetime v0.2.3 fails to build on OpenBSD.

This fixes #1784 .
